questions.question: She did the dishes, vacuumed, changed bedding, bathed her son, rocked him, and felt at peace.

choices.answer: Family is worth the hard work.

questions.question: She stayed home to study instead of going to the movies with her friends.

choices.answer: Make decisions that are good for you.
Good friends are hard to find.

questions.question: Allen stopped his car to pick up the old tire and dirty old bucket from the side of the road.

choices.answer: We all need to take care of the earth.

questions.question: Rose carried the groceries into the house for her elderly neighbor.

choices.answer: Be careful with things that don't belong to you.
Be a good neighbor so your neighbor will be good to you.
Teach your neighbor to be healthy.

questions.question: Sue has batteries, a weather radio, bottled water, canned goods, and candles for emergencies.

choices.answer: Check expiration dates on cans and batteries.
Listen for dangerous weather and conditions.

questions.question: Carol bought a cake, balloons, and treats for her husband's birthday.

choices.answer: Celebrate the good things in life.
Money shows the depth of love.

questions.question: Mrs. Smith filled her bird-feeders before the snowstorm was predicted to arrive.

choices.answer: We need to take care of Earth's animals.
We need to take care of the earth.

questions.question: Sue's mom always looked in the newspapers for coupons on items her family used or enjoyed.

choices.answer: Newspapers are important to a family.
Coupons are found in the newspaper.
Saving money is a good habit.

questions.question: Sue and Rose always discuss the problems and issues that hurt their valued friendship.

choices.answer: Problems happened between Sue and Rose.

questions.question: Mike turned off the lights and unplugged unnecessary appliances when not in use.

choices.answer: Energy is abundant and we do not need to worry.
